poem:
"Remembrance of a Young Life Lost"

In each pound raised, a tear unfurled,
For a schoolboy, no longer part of this world.
The northeast wind whispers Daniel's name,
While London streets echo his homebound game.
Two officers, two victims, tangled tale,
An echo of violence, a sorrowful wail.
From Hainault's sorrow, compassion's raise,
For Daniel, a mournful, love-laden praise.
